snippet: Already deeply concerned about its rapidly dwindling population, Germany found 1.5 million fewer inhabitants than previously assumed.
abstract: Germany, which has been deeply concerned about its rapidly dwindling population, releases results of its first census in nearly a quarter of a century and finds 1.5 million fewer inhabitants than previously assumed; many worry how future smaller generations will repay German debts, much less the mounting liabilities and guarantees meant to contain the euro-zone debt crisis.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and CHRIS COTTRELL

lead_paragraph: Already deeply concerned about its rapidly dwindling population, Germany found 1.5 million fewer inhabitants than previously assumed.

headline.seo: Census Shows New Drop in Germany’s Population
headline.main: Germany Counts Heads and Finds 1.5 Million Fewer Residents Than It Expected
headline.print_headline: Germany Counts Heads and Finds 1.5 Million Fewer Residents Than It Expected
